text: The Gray County Courthouse in Pampa, Texas was built in 1929. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1998. It was designed in Beaux- Arts style by architects W.R. Kaufman & Son, and was built by Harland L. Case. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Gray County, Texas *Recorded Texas Historic Landmarks in Gray County *List of county courthouses in Texas ==References== Category:Courthouses in Texas Category:Courthouses on the National Register of Historic Places in Texas Category:National Register of Historic Places in Gray County, Texas Category:Beaux-Arts architecture in Texas Category:Government buildings completed in 1929
title: Gray County Courthouse (Texas)
